verses.verse: And he commanded<WH6680> the steward<WH834> <WH5921> of his house,<WH1004> saying,<WH559> Fill<WH4390> the men's<WH582> sacks<WH572> with food,<WH400> as much<WH834> as they can<WH3201> carry,<WH5375> and put<WH7760> every man's<WH376> money<WH3701> in his sack's<WH572> mouth.<WH6310>

And put<WH7760> my cup,<WH1375> the silver<WH3701> cup,<WH1375> in the sack's<WH572> mouth<WH6310> of the youngest,<WH6996> and his corn<WH7668> money.<WH3701> And he did<WH6213> according to the word<WH1697> that Joseph<WH3130> had spoken.<WH1696>
As soon as the morning<WH1242> was light,<WH216> the men<WH582> were sent<WH7971> away, they and their asses.<WH2543>

And when they were gone<WH3318> out of the city,<WH5892> and not yet far<WH7368> off, Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to his steward,<WH834> <WH5921> Up, follow<WH7291> after<WH310> the men;<WH582> and when you do overtake<WH5381> them, say<WH559> to them, Why<WH4100> have you rewarded<WH7999> evil<WH7451> for good?<WH2896>
Is not this<WH2088> it in which<WH834> my lord<WH113> drinks,<WH8354> and whereby indeed he divines?<WH5172> you have done evil<WH7489> in so<WH834> doing.<WH6213>
And he overtook<WH5381> them, and he spoke<WH1696> to them these<WH411> same words.<WH1697>

And they said<WH559> to him, Why<WH4100> said<WH1696> my lord<WH113> these<WH428> words?<WH1697> God forbid<WH2486> that your servants<WH5650> should do<WH6213> according to this<WH2088> thing:<WH1697>

Behold,<WH2005> the money,<WH3701> which<WH834> we found<WH4672> in our sacks' <WH572>mouths,<WH6310> we brought<WH7725> again<WH7725> to you out of the land<WH776> of Canaan:<WH3667> how<WH349> then should we steal<WH1589> out of your lord's<WH113> house<WH1004> silver<WH3701> or<WH176> gold?<WH2091>
With whomsoever<WH834> of your servants<WH5650> it be found,<WH4672> both let him die,<WH4191> and we also<WH1571> will be my lord's<WH113> slaves.<WH5650>
And he said,<WH559> Now<WH6258> also<WH1571> let it be according to your words:<WH1697> he with whom<WH834> it is found<WH4672> shall be my servant;<WH5650> and you shall be blameless.<WH5355>
Then they speedily<WH4116> took<WH3381> down<WH3381> every man<WH376> his sack<WH572> to the ground,<WH776> and opened<WH6605> every man<WH376> his sack.<WH572>
And he searched,<WH2664> and began<WH2490> at the oldest,<WH1419> and left<WH3615> at the youngest:<WH6996> and the cup<WH1375> was found<WH4672> in Benjamin's<WH1144> sack.<WH572>
Then they rent<WH7167> their clothes,<WH8071> and laded<WH6006> every man<WH376> his ass,<WH2543> and returned<WH7725> to the city.<WH5892>
And Judah<WH3063> and his brothers<WH251> came<WH935> to Joseph's<WH3130> house;<WH1004> for he was yet<WH5750> there:<WH8033> and they fell<WH5307> before<WH6440> him on the ground.<WH776>
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to them, What<WH4100> deed<WH4639> is this<WH2088> that you have done?<WH6213> know<WH3045> you not that such a man<WH376> as I can certainly divine?<WH5172>

And Judah<WH3063> said,<WH559> What<WH4100> shall we say<WH559> to my lord?<WH113> what<WH4100> shall we speak?<WH1696> or how<WH4100> shall we clear<WH6663> ourselves? God<WH430> has found<WH4672> out the iniquity<WH5771> of your servants:<WH5650> behold,<WH2009> we are my lord's<WH113> servants,<WH5650> both<WH1571> we, and he also<WH1571> with whom<WH834> the cup<WH1375> is found.<WH4672>

And he said,<WH559> God forbid<WH2486> that I should do<WH6213> so:<WH2063> but the man<WH376> in whose hand<WH3027> the cup<WH1375> is found,<WH4672> he shall be my servant;<WH5650> and as for you, get<WH5927> you up in peace<WH7965> to your father.<WH1>

Then Judah<WH3063> came<WH5066> near<WH5066> to him, and said,<WH559> Oh<WH994> my lord,<WH113> let your servant,<WH5650> I pray<WH4994> you, speak<WH1696> a word<WH1697> in my lord's<WH113> ears,<WH241> and let not your anger<WH639> burn<WH2734> against your servant:<WH5650> for you are even as Pharaoh.<WH6547>
My lord<WH113> asked<WH7592> his servants,<WH5650> saying,<WH559> Have<WH3426> you a father,<WH1> or<WH176> a brother?<WH251>

And we said<WH559> to my lord,<WH113> We have<WH3426> a father,<WH1> an old<WH2205> man,<WH376> and a child<WH3206> of his old<WH2208> age, a little<WH6996> one; and his brother<WH251> is dead,<WH4191> and he alone<WH905> is left<WH3498> of his mother,<WH517> and his father<WH1> loves<WH157> him.
And you said<WH559> to your servants,<WH5650> Bring<WH3381> him down<WH3381> to me, that I may set<WH7760> my eyes<WH5869> on him.
And we said<WH559> to my lord,<WH113> The lad<WH5288> cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> leave<WH5800> his father:<WH1> for if he should leave<WH5800> his father,<WH1> his father would die.<WH4191>

And you said<WH559> to your servants,<WH5650> Except<WH518> <WH3808> your youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> come<WH3381> down<WH3381> with you, you shall see<WH7200> my face<WH6440> no<WH3808> more.<WH3254>
And it came<WH1961> to pass when<WH3588> we came<WH5927> up to your servant<WH5650> my father,<WH1> we told<WH5046> him the words<WH1697> of my lord.<WH113>
And our father<WH1> said,<WH559> Go<WH7725> again,<WH7725> and buy<WH7666> us a little<WH4592> food.<WH400>

And we said,<WH559> We cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> go<WH3381> down:<WH3381> if<WH518> our youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> be with us, then will we go<WH3381> down:<WH3381> for we may<WH3201> not see<WH7200> the man's<WH376> face,<WH6440> except<WH369> our youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> be with us.
And your servant<WH5650> my father<WH1> said<WH559> to us, You know<WH3045> that my wife<WH802> bore<WH3205> me two<WH8147> sons:
And the one<WH259> went<WH3318> out from me, and I said,<WH559> Surely<WH389> he is torn<WH2963> in pieces; and I saw<WH7200> him not since:<WH2008>

And if<WH518> you take<WH3947> this<WH2088> also<WH1571> from me, and mischief<WH611> befall<WH7136> him, you shall bring<WH3381> down<WH3381> my gray<WH7872> hairs with sorrow<WH7451> to the grave.<WH7585>

Now<WH6258> therefore when I come<WH935> to your servant<WH5650> my father,<WH1> and the lad<WH5288> be not with us; seeing that his life<WH5315> is bound<WH7194> up in the lad's<WH5288> life;<WH5315>

It shall come<WH1961> to pass, when he sees<WH7200> that the lad<WH5288> is not with us, that he will die:<WH4191> and your servants<WH5650> shall bring<WH3381> down<WH3381> the gray<WH7872> hairs of your servant<WH5650> our father<WH1> with sorrow<WH3015> to the grave.<WH7585>

For your servant<WH5650> became<WH6148> surety<WH6148> for the lad<WH5288> to my father,<WH1> saying,<WH559> If<WH518> I bring<WH935> him not to you, then I shall bear<WH2398> the blame<WH2398> to my father<WH1> for ever.<WH3605>

Now<WH6258> therefore, I pray<WH4994> you, let your servant<WH5650> abide<WH3427> instead<WH8478> of the lad<WH5288> a slave<WH5650> to my lord;<WH113> and let the lad<WH5288> go<WH5927> up with his brothers.<WH251>
For how<WH349> shall I go<WH5927> up to my father,<WH1> and the lad<WH5288> be not with me? lest<WH6435> peradventure I see<WH7200> the evil<WH7451> that shall come<WH4672> on my father.<WH1>
